name: cron
signature: { (cron: Cron): Schedule<[number, number], unknown, never>; (expression: string, tz?: string | TimeZone): Schedule<[number, number], unknown, never>; }
description:
Creates a schedule that recurs based on a cron expression.
*Details This schedule automatically executes at intervals defined by a cron
expression. It triggers at the beginning of each matched interval and
produces timestamps representing the start and end of the cron window. The cron `expression` is validated lazily, meaning errors may only be
detected when the schedule is executed.
documentation:
Creates a schedule that recurs based on a cron expression.
*Details**

This schedule automatically executes at intervals defined by a cron
expression. It triggers at the beginning of each matched interval and
produces timestamps representing the start and end of the cron window.

The cron `expression` is validated lazily, meaning errors may only be
detected when the schedule is executed.
